[##Simple Present]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228740]
[%Nr. 4010]
[!Schreibe die richtige Verbformen in die Lücken. Benutze das Simple Present in den Aussagesätzen. ]

0. I [_swim][@example] in the lake. __(to swim)__

1. We [_call][!to call] our dog. [?Infinitiv call (wegen we)]
2. Emma [_dreams][!to dream] in the lessons. [?Infintiv dream + Endung s (wegen Emma)]
3. They [_look][!to look] at birds. [?Infinitiv look (wegen they)]
4. John [_comes][!to come] home from school. [?Infinitiv come + Endung s (wegen John)]
5. I [_meet][!to meet] my friends. [?Infinitiv meet]
6. He [_repairs][!to repair] the laptop. [?Infinitiv repair + Endung s (wegen he)]
7. Walter and Frank [_say][!to say] hello. [?Infinitiv say (wegen Walter and Frank)]
8. The cat [_sits][!to sit] under the tree. [?Infinitiv sit + Endung s (wegen the cat)]
9. You [_drink][!to drink] water. [?Infinitiv drink]
10. She [_forgets][!to forget] the lunchbox. [?Infinitiv forget + Endung s (wegen she)]

bit.body:
0. I {0} in the lake. __(to swim)__

1. We {1} our dog. 
2. Emma {2} in the lessons. 
3. They {3} at birds. 
4. John {4} home from school. 
5. I {5} my friends. 
6. He {6} the laptop. 
7. Walter and Frank {7} hello. 
8. The cat {8} under the tree. 
9. You {9} water. 
10. She {10} the lunchbox.
bit.hint: Infinitiv forget + Endung s (wegen she)
bit.instruction: Schreibe die richtige Verbformen in die Lücken. Benutze das Simple Present in den Aussagesätzen.

[%Nr. 4012]
[!Schreibe die richtige Verbformen in die Lücken. Benutze das Simple Present in den Aussagesätzen. ]

0. We often [_shout][@example] her name. __(to shout)__

1. I [_get][!to get] good marks. [?Infinitiv get (wegen I)]
2. Rita [_does][!to do] exercises. [?Infinitiv do + Endung es (wegen Rita). Da do auf -o endet wird -es angehängt. ]
3. We often [_lay][!to lay] the table. [?Infinitiv lay (wegen we)]
4. Tim and Pat [_upload][!to upload] the pictures. [?Infinitiv upload (wegen Tim and Pat)]
5. Oliver always [_has][!to have] fun. [?3. Person Singular/Einzahl von have ist has (wegen Oliver)]
6. Maria sometimes [_tidies up][!to tidy up] their room. [?Infinitiv tidy + Endung es (wegen Maria) + up. Das -y wird zu -i, da zuvor der Konsonant -d steht. ]
7. He often [_buys][!to buy] new shoes. [?Infinitiv buy + Endung s (wegen he)]
8. The dog never [_runs][!to run] out of the house. [?Infinitiv run + Endung s (wegen the dog)]
9. You [_need][!to need] your glasses. [?Infinitiv need (wegen you)]
10. She [_touches][!to touch] snakes. [?Infinitiv touch + Endung es (wegen she). Nach Zischlaut wird -es angehängt. ]

bit.body:
0. We often {0} her name. __(to shout)__

1. I {1} good marks. 
2. Rita {2} exercises. 
3. We often {3} the table. 
4. Tim and Pat {4} the pictures. 
5. Oliver always {5} fun. 
6. Maria sometimes {6} their room. 
7. He often {7} new shoes. 
8. The dog never {8} out of the house. 
9. You {9} your glasses. 
10. She {10} snakes.
bit.hint: Infinitiv touch + Endung es (wegen she). Nach Zischlaut wird -es angehängt.

[%Nr. 1312]
[!Schreibe die richtige Verbform in die Lücke. Benutze das Simple Present. ]

0. [_Do][@example] they [_phone][@example] their friends? (__to phone__)

1. [_Do] you [_drink][!to drink] mineral water? [?do (wegen you) + Subjekt + Infinitiv drink]
2. [_Do] Sarah and Linda [_feed][!to feed] their pets? [?do (wegen Sarah and Linda) + Subjekt + Infinitiv feed]
3. [_Does] your teacher [_check][!to check] your homework? [?does (wegen your teacher) + Subjekt + Infinitiv check]
4. [_Do] they [_live][!to live] in the old house? [?do (wegen they) + Subjekt + Infinitiv live]
5. [_Does] the cat [_sit][!to sit] on the wall in the mornings? [?does (wegen the cat) + Subjekt + Infinitiv sit]
6. [_Does] Nina [_play][!to play] computer games? [?does (wegen Nina) + Subjekt + Infinitiv play]
7. [_Do] your parents [_watch][!to watch] TV in the afternoon? [?do (wegen your parents) + Subjekt + Infinitiv watch]
8. [_Does] your grandmother [_answer][!to answer] the phone? 
[?does (wegen your grandmother) + Subjekt + Infinitiv answer]
9. [_Does] Andy [_do][!to do] the shopping? [?does (wegen Andy) + Subjekt + Infinitiv do]
10. [_Do] Garry and Ken [_have][!to have] a cup of tea in the afternoon? [?do (wegen Garry and Ken) + Subjekt + Infinitiv have]

bit.body:
0. {0} they {1} their friends? (__to phone__)

1. {2} you {3} mineral water? 
2. {4} Sarah and Linda {5} their pets? 
3. {6} your teacher {7} your homework? 
4. {8} they {9} in the old house? 
5. {10} the cat {11} on the wall in the mornings? 
6. {12} Nina {13} computer games? 
7. {14} your parents {15} TV in the afternoon? 
8. {16} your grandmother {17} the phone? 

9. {18} Andy {19} the shopping? 
10. {20} Garry and Ken {21} a cup of tea in the afternoon?
bit.hint: do (wegen Garry and Ken) + Subjekt + Infinitiv have

[%Nr. 1314]
[!Schreibe die richtigen Verbformen und die Substantive in die Lücken. Benutze das Simple Present. ]

0. [_Do they phone][@example] their friends? (__they/to phone__)

1. [_Do you walk][!you/to walk] to school? [?do (wegen you) + Subjekt you + Infinitiv walk]
2. [_Does Ronda eat][!Ronda/to eat] a banana in the morning? 
[?does (wegen Ronda) + Subjekt Ronda + Infinitiv eat]
3. [_Does your father like][!your father/to like] parrots? [?does (wegen your father) + Subjekt your father + Infinitiv like]
4. [_Does Wendy share][!Wendy/to share] a room with her sister?[?does (wegen Wendy) + Subjekt Wendy + Infinitiv share]
5. [_Does it rain][!it/to rain] a lot in England? [?does (wegen it) + Subjekt it + Infinitiv rain]
6. [_Do the friends do][!the friends/to do] sports after school? [?do (wegen the friends) + Subjekt the friends + Infinitiv do]
7. [_Do Susan and Jack go][!Susan and Jack/to do] camping in summer? [?do (wegen Susan and Jack) + Subjekt Susan and Jack + Infinitiv do]
8. [_Do they invite][!they/to invite] their friends to the party? [?do (wegen they) + Subjekt they + Infinitiv invite]
9. [_Do we wait][!we/to wait] at the bus stop? [?do (wegen we) + Subjekt we + Infinitiv wait]
10. [_Does he smile][!he/to smile] in the morning? [?does(wegen he) + Subjekt he + Infinitiv smile]

bit.body:
0. {0} their friends? (__they/to phone__)

1. {1} to school? 
2. {2} a banana in the morning? 

3. {3} parrots? 
4. {4} a room with her sister?
5. {5} a lot in England? 
6. {6} sports after school? 
7. {7} camping in summer? 
8. {8} their friends to the party? 
9. {9} at the bus stop? 
10. {10} in the morning?
bit.hint: does(wegen he) + Subjekt he + Infinitiv smile

[%Nr. 1414]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde eine Frage mit einem Fragewort. Beachte die Zeitform (Simple Present) und die Wortstellung bei den Fragen. ]

0. How [_does this machine work?][@example] (__this machine/to work__)

1. When [_do the girls go home][!the girls/to go/home]? [?Fragewort + do (wegen the girls) + Subjekt the girls + Infinitiv go + Ort home]
2. Where [_are you][!you/to be]? [?Fragewort + are (wegen you) + Subjekt you]
3. Why [_does Jack need a green pen][!Jack/to need/a green pen]? [?Fragewort + does (wegen Jack) + Subjekt Jack + Infinitiv need + Objekt a green pen]
4. When [_is your birthday][!your birthday/to be]? [?Fragewort + is (wegen your birthday) + Subjekt your birthday]
5. Where [_does Lenny live][!Lenny/to live]? [?Fragewort + does (wegen Lenny) + Subjekt Lenny + Infinitiv live]
6. What videos [_does she like][!she/to like]? [?Fragewort + does (wegen she) + Subjekt she + Infinitiv like]
7. How old [_is your mother][!your mother/to be]? [?Fragewort + is (wegen your mother) + Subjekt your mother + Infinitiv is]
8. Where [_do your friends work][!your friends/to work]? [?Fragewort + do (wegen your friends) + Subjekt your friends + Infinitiv work]
9. What [_do you think of this car?][!you/to think/of this car]? [?Fragewort + do (wegen you) + Subjekt you + Infinitiv think + Objekt of this car]
10. How [_do I cook rice][!I/to cook/rice]? [?Fragewort + do (wegen I) + Subjekt I + Infinitiv cook + Objekt rice]

bit.body:
0. How {0} (__this machine/to work__)

1. When {1}? 
2. Where {2}? 
3. Why {3}? 
4. When {4}? 
5. Where {5}? 
6. What videos {6}? 
7. How old {7}? 
8. Where {8}? 
9. What {9}? 
10. How {10}?
bit.hint: Fragewort + do (wegen I) + Subjekt I + Infinitiv cook + Objekt rice
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde eine Frage mit einem Fragewort. Beachte die Zeitform (Simple Present) und die Wortstellung bei den Fragen.

do you think of this car?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228745]
[%Nr. 4692]
[!Nutze die in Klammern stehenden Verben und bilde Fragen mit Fragewörtern und die dazugehörigen Antworten im **Simple Present**. Beachte das Beispiel. ]

0. When [_does][@example] Bella [_have][@example] breakfast? → She [_has][@example] breakfast at 6:30. (__to have__)

1. Where [_do] they [_meet][!to meet] after work? → They [_meet][!to meet] in a café. [?Frage: do (wegen they) + meet. Antwort: meet (wegen they)]
2. Where [_does] Ella [_live][!to live]? → She [_lives][!to live] in Dublin. [?Frage: does (wegen Ella) + live. Antwort: lives (wegen she)]
3. When [_do] you [_work][!to work] in the garden? → I [_work][!to work] in the garden every afternoon. [?Frage: do (wegen you) + work. Antwort: work (wegen I)]
4. Where [_does] he [_play][!to play] volleyball? → He [_plays][!to play] volleyball in the gym. [?Frage: does (wegen he) + play. Antwort: plays (wegen he)]
5. What sport [_do] you [_watch][!to watch] in winter? → We [_watch][!to watch] snowboarding. [?Frage: do (wegen you) + watch. Antwort: watch (wegen we)]
6. What [_do] you [_drink][!to drink] at lunch? → I [_drink][!to drink] water. [?Frage: do (wegen you) + drink. Antwort: drink (wegen I)]
7. When [_does] Henry [_go][!to go] to the office? → He [_goes][!to go] to the office at 7 o'clock. [?Frage: does (wegen Henry) + go. Antwort: goes (wegen he)]
8. How [_do] you [_like][!to like] your toast? → I [_like][!to like] my toast with jam. [?Frage: do (wegen you) + like. Antwort: like (wegen I)]
9. When [_does] she [_come][!to come] home on Mondays? → She [_comes][!to come] home at 5 o'clock. [?Frage: does (wegen she) + come. Antwort: comes (wegen she)]
10. What [_does] your cat usually [_eat][!to eat]? → She usually [_eats][!to eat] chicken. [?Frage: does (wegen your cat) + eat. Antwort: eats (wegen she)]

bit.body:
0. When {0} Bella {1} breakfast? → She {2} breakfast at 6:30. (__to have__)

1. Where {3} they {4} after work? → They {5} in a café. 
2. Where {6} Ella {7}? → She {8} in Dublin. 
3. When {9} you {10} in the garden? → I {11} in the garden every afternoon. 
4. Where {12} he {13} volleyball? → He {14} volleyball in the gym. 
5. What sport {15} you {16} in winter? → We {17} snowboarding. 
6. What {18} you {19} at lunch? → I {20} water. 
7. When {21} Henry {22} to the office? → He {23} to the office at 7 o'clock. 
8. How {24} you {25} your toast? → I {26} my toast with jam. 
9. When {27} she {28} home on Mondays? → She {29} home at 5 o'clock. 
10. What {30} your cat usually {31}? → She usually {32} chicken.
bit.hint: Frage: does (wegen your cat) + eat. Antwort: eats (wegen she)
bit.instruction: Nutze die in Klammern stehenden Verben und bilde Fragen mit Fragewörtern und die dazugehörigen Antworten im **Simple Present**. Beachte das Beispiel.

[%Nr. 4674]
[!Setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde so eine Frage ohne Fragewort und die dazugehörige Kurzantwort im Simple Present. Beachte das Beispiel. ]

0. [_Does][@example] Berry collect comics? → Yes, [_she does][@example]. 

1. [_Do] the boys like music? → Yes, [_they do]. [?Frage: do (wegen the boys). Kurzantwort: they + do]
2. [_Does] he play the guitar? → No, [_he doesn't]. [?Frage: does (wegen he). Kurzantwort: he + doesn't oder does not]
3. [_Do] they walk to work? → Yes, [_they do]. [?Frage: do (wegen they). Kurzantwort: they + do]
4. [_Does] Jack often clean the bathroom? → Yes, [_he does]. [?Frage: does (wegen Jack). Kurzantwort: he + does]
5. [_Do] you speak English? → Yes, [_I do]. [?Frage: do (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I oder we (Antwort auf you) + do]
6. [_Do] Tim and Harry live in Sydney? → No, [_they don't]. [?Frage: do (wegen Tim And Harry). Kurzantwort: they don't oder do not]
7. [_Does] Olivia have a sister? → No, [_she doesn't]. [?Frage: does (wegen Olivia). Kurzantwort: she + doesn't oder does not]
8. [_Does] the museum open every day? → Yes, [_it does]. [?Frage: does (wegen the museum). Kurzantwort: it + does]
9. [_Do] you do the shopping? → No, [_I don't]. [?Frage: do (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I oder we (Antwort auf you) + do]
10. [_Do] the Smiths sell cars? → No, [_they don't]. [?Frage: do (wegen the Smiths). Kurzantwort: they + don't oder do not]

bit.body:
0. {0} Berry collect comics? → Yes, {1}. 

1. {2} the boys like music? → Yes, {3}. 
2. {4} he play the guitar? → No, {5}. 
3. {6} they walk to work? → Yes, {7}. 
4. {8} Jack often clean the bathroom? → Yes, {9}. 
5. {10} you speak English? → Yes, {11}. 
6. {12} Tim and Harry live in Sydney? → No, {13}. 
7. {14} Olivia have a sister? → No, {15}. 
8. {16} the museum open every day? → Yes, {17}. 
9. {18} you do the shopping? → No, {19}. 
10. {20} the Smiths sell cars? → No, {21}.
bit.hint: Frage: do (wegen the Smiths). Kurzantwort: they + don't oder do not

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:228747]
[%Nr. 4044]
[!Finde das richtige Signalwort für die Sätze im Simple Present. ]
1. School starts at 8 o'clock [+on Mondays][-at the moment][-last week]. 
2. [+Sometimes][-Now][-Look] they go shopping with their aunt. 
3. My father gets up at 4 o'clock [-at the moment][+every morning][-tomorrow]. 
4. His sister has guitar lessons [-last Tuesday][+after school][-yet]. 
5. [+Usually][-Now][-Tomorrow] I play handball. 
6. His brother always washes his car [-at the moment][+on Saturdays][-a week ago]. 
7. The supermarket closes at 10 pm [-last month][+every Saturday][-already]. 
8. We listen to music [+regularly][-next Sunday][-three days ago]. 
9. I fly to Austria [-next winter][-last winter][+every winter]. 
10. The train to London leaves [+every two hours][-the last two hours][-two hours ago].

bit.body:
1. School starts at 8 o'clock {0}. 
2. {1} they go shopping with their aunt. 
3. My father gets up at 4 o'clock {2}. 
4. His sister has guitar lessons {3}. 
5. {4} I play handball. 
6. His brother always washes his car {5}. 
7. The supermarket closes at 10 pm {6}. 
8. We listen to music {7}. 
9. I fly to Austria {8}. 
10. The train to London leaves {9}.
bit.instruction: Finde das richtige Signalwort für die Sätze im Simple Present.

bitmark:
[.cloze-and-multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:228748]
[%Nr. 4046]
[!In der Übung kannst du dein Wissen zu den Regeln im Simple Present testen. 
Suche dir dazu aus den vorgegebenen Antworten die richtige aus oder setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein. ]

1. Das __Simple Present__ verwende ich für Handlungen, [-die gerade abgeschlossen wurden][-die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen][+die wiederholt geschehen]. 
2. Typische Signalwörter für das __Simple__ Present sind [-already, just, so far, yet][+always, everyday, often, sometimes][-at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now]. 
3. Für __Simple Present__ verwende ich das Verb im [_Infinitiv]. 
4. In der 3. Person Singular __(he, she, it)__, hänge ich [_s] an den [_Infinitiv] des Verbs an, bei Zischlauten hänge ich [_es] an. 
5. Das __Simple Present__ verneine ich mit [-did + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][+do/does + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][-have/has + not + past participle]. 
6. Bei Verneinungen in der 3. Person Singular __(he, she, it)__, nehme ich [-did + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][+does + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][-has + not + past participle]. 
7. Für **do + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform [_don't] stehen, für **does + not** __kann__ [_doesn't] stehen. 
8. Bei **Fragen nach dem Objekt, der Ort und der Zeit** nehme ich [-das Verb im Simple Present][-did + Infinitiv des Verbs][+do/does + Infinitiv des Verbs]. 
9. Bei **Fragen nach dem Subjekt** nehme ich [+das Verb im Simple Present][-did + Infinitiv des Verbs][-do/does + Infinitiv des Verbs]. 
10. Das Verb **be** __kann__ im Simple Present drei Formen haben. 
Ich benutze [_am] mit __I__, [_is] mit __he, she, it__ und [_are] mit __we, you, they__.

bit.body:
1. Das __Simple Present__ verwende ich für Handlungen, {0}. 
2. Typische Signalwörter für das __Simple__ Present sind {1}. 
3. Für __Simple Present__ verwende ich das Verb im {2}. 
4. In der 3. Person Singular __(he, she, it)__, hänge ich {3} an den {4} des Verbs an, bei Zischlauten hänge ich {5} an. 
5. Das __Simple Present__ verneine ich mit {6}. 
6. Bei Verneinungen in der 3. Person Singular __(he, she, it)__, nehme ich {7}. 
7. Für **do + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform {8} stehen, für **does + not** __kann__ {9} stehen. 
8. Bei **Fragen nach dem Objekt, der Ort und der Zeit** nehme ich {10}. 
9. Bei **Fragen nach dem Subjekt** nehme ich {11}. 
10. Das Verb **be** __kann__ im Simple Present drei Formen haben. 
Ich benutze {12} mit __I__, {13} mit __he, she, it__ und {14} mit __we, you, they__.

options.text: die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen
at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228751]
[%Nr. 4026]
[!Vervollständige die Sätze. 

Benutze nur die Langformen der Hilfsverben. ]

0. Jane [_does not read][@example] books. __(not/to read)__

1. Tom [_does not collect][!not/to collect] stamps. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Tom) + not + Infinitiv collect]
2. You [_do not sing][!not/to sing] songs in the bathroom. [?Verneinug: do (wegen you) + not + Infinitiv sing]
3. Julie [_does not work][!not/to work] in the garden. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Julie) + not + Infinitiv work]
4. I [_do not sit][!not/to sit] at home. [?Verneninug: do (wegen I) + not + Infinitiv sit]
5. Tina and Kate [_do not open][!not/to open] the windows. [?Verneinung: do (wegen Tina and Kate) + not + Infinitiv open]
6. Adam [_does not speak][!not/to speak] French. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Adam) + not + Infinitiv speak]
7. His sister [_does not like][!not/to like] lemonade. [?Verneinung: does (wegen her sister) + not + Infinitiv like]
8. We [_do not listen][!not/to listen] to music. [?Verneinung: do (wegen we) + not + Infinitiv listen]
9. My father [_does not clean][!(not/to clean)] the car every Saturday. [?Verneinung: does (wegen my father) + not + Infinitiv clean]
10. Johnny and Danny [_do not swim][!not/to swim] in the lake. [?Verneinung: do (wegen Johnny and Danny) + not + Infinitiv swim]

bit.body:
0. Jane {0} books. __(not/to read)__

1. Tom {1} stamps. 
2. You {2} songs in the bathroom. 
3. Julie {3} in the garden. 
4. I {4} at home. 
5. Tina and Kate {5} the windows. 
6. Adam {6} French. 
7. His sister {7} lemonade. 
8. We {8} to music. 
9. My father {9} the car every Saturday.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228752]

Du kannst entweder die Langformen oder die Kurzformen der Hilfsverben verwenden. ]

0. Tom **writes** letters. → Tom [_does not write][@example] write letters. __oder__ Tom [_doesn't][@example] write letters. 

1. They **play** volleyball every week. → They [_do not play][_don't] volleyball every week. [?Verneinung: do (wegen they) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
2. John **is** nice. → John [_is not][_isn't] nice. [?Das Verb __to be__ kann direkt verneint werden. Verneinung: is (wegen John) + not. Kurzform: isn't]
3. This car **makes** a lot of noise. → This car [_does not make][_doesn't make] a lot of noise. [?Verneinung: does (wegen this car) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]
4. I **like** computer games. → I [_do not like][_don't like] computer games. [?Verneinung: do (wegen I) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
5. We **are** from Greece. → We [_are not][_aren't] from Greece. [?Das Verb to be kann direkt verneint werden. Verneinung: are (wegen we) + not. Kurzform: aren't]
6. You **wear** pullovers. → You [_do not wear][_don't wear] pullovers. [?Verneinung: do (wegen you) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
7. They **speak** English. → They [_do not speak][_don't speak] English. [?Verneinung: do (wegen they) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
8. He **watches** TV. → He [_does not watch][_doesn't watch] TV. [?Verneinung: does (wegen he) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]
9. I **am** from Spain. → I [_am not][_'m] from Spain. [?Verneinung: Das Verb to be kann direkt verneint werden. Verneinung: am (wegen I) + not. Kurzform: I'm not]
10. Steve **draws** nice pictures. → Steve [_does not draw][_doesn't draw] nice pictures. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Steve) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]

1. They **play** volleyball every week. → They {2} volleyball every week. 
2. John **is** nice. → John {3} nice. 
3. This car **makes** a lot of noise. → This car {4} a lot of noise. 
4. I **like** computer games. → I {5} computer games. 
5. We **are** from Greece. → We {6} from Greece.

0. Jack plays in the school handball team. → Jack [_does not play][@example] in the school handball team. __oder__ Jack [_doesn't play][@example] in the school handball team.

3. Sandy **does** the housework every Thursday. → Sandy [_does not do][_doesn't do] the housework every Thursday. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Sandy) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]
4. The boys **have** two rabbits. → The boys [_do not have][_don't have] two rabbits. [?Verneinung: do (wegen the boys) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: dont']
5. Simon **can read** English books. → Simon [_cannot read][_can't read] English books. [?Verneinung: can + not + Infinitiv (cannot). Kurzform: can't. Achtung: Das Hilfsverb can can direkt verneint werden cannot. ]
6. He **listens** to the radio every evening. → He [_does not listen][_doesn't listen] to the radio every evening. [?Verneinung: does (wegen he) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]

10. Lessons **always finish** at 3 o'clock. → Lessons [_do not always finish][_don't always finish] at 3 o'clock. [?Verneinung: do (wegen lessons) + not + always + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't. Achtung: Das Häufigkeitsadverb always steht immer vor dem Vollverb finish. ]

3. We live in a small house. → We [_do not live][_don't live] in a small house. [?Verneinung: do (wegen we) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
4. I have coffee for breakfast. → I [_do not have][_don't have] coffee for breakfast. [?Verneinung: do (wegen I) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
5. Water boils at 90°C. → Water [_does not boil][_doesn't boil] at 90°C. [?Verneinung: does (wegen water) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't]
6. My brothers work in a café. → My brothers [_do not work][_don't work] in a café. [?Verneinung: do (wegen my brothers) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
7. Marie and Helen do judo. → Marie and Helen [_do not do][_don't do] judo. [?Verneinung: do (wegen Marie and Helen) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
8. The dog always barks. → The dog [_does not always bark][_doesn't always bark]. [?Verneinung: does (wegen the dog) + not + always + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't. Achtung: Das Häufigkeitsadverb always steht immer vor dem Vollverb bark. ]
9. I remember Bill quite well. → I [_do not remember][_don't remember] Bill quite well. [?Verneinung: do (wegen I) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: don't]
10. Kate can sing alone. → Kate [_cannot sing][_can't sing] alone. [?Verneinung: can + not + Infinitiv (cannot). Kurzform: can't. Achtung: Das Hilfsverb can can direkt verneint werden cannot. ]

bit.body:
0. Josephine knows the new words. → Josephine {0} the new words. oder Josephine {1} the new words. 

1. The girls are outside. → The girls {2} outside. 
2. She knows the answer. → She {3} the answer. 
3. We live in a small house. → We {4} in a small house. 
4. I have coffee for breakfast. → I {5} coffee for breakfast. 
5. Water boils at 90°C. → Water {6} at 90°C. 
6. My brothers work in a café. → My brothers {7} in a café. 
7. Marie and Helen do judo. → Marie and Helen {8} judo. 
8. The dog always barks. → The dog {9}. 
9. I remember Bill quite well. → I {10} Bill quite well. 
10. Kate can sing alone. → Kate {11} alone.
bit.hint: Verneinung: can + not + Infinitiv (cannot). Kurzform: can't. Achtung: Das Hilfsverb can can direkt verneint werden cannot.
bit.instruction:
Verneine den vorderen Satz. Schreibe jeweils die Verneinung der Verbverbindung in die jeweilige Lücke. 

Du kannst entweder die Langformen oder die Kurzformen der Hilfsverben verwenden.

3. [_Do] you [_speak][!to speak] English? [?Benutze do (wegen you). Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]

5. [_Does] Anne [_have][!to have] any hobbies? [?Benutze does (wegen Anne). Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]

7. Leroy [_cannot read][_can't read][!can/not/to read] very fast. [?Verneinung: can + not + Infinitiv (cannot). Kurzform: can't. Achtung: Das Hilfsverb can can direkt verneint werden cannot. ]
8. [_Do] Jim and Joe [_water][!to water] the flowers every week? [?Benutze do (wegen Jim and Joe). Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
9. Yvonne's mother [_does not ride][_doesn't ride][!not/to ride] a motorbike. [?Verneinung: does (wegen Yvonne's mother) + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: doesn't ride]
10. [_Does] Elisabeth [_drink][!to drink] cola? [?Benutze does (wegen Elisabeth). Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]

9. She [_washed][!to wash] her hair. [?Infinitiv + ed]

1. Where [_did] she [_go][!to go] yesterday evening? → She [_went][!to go] shopping. [?Frage: did + go did + Infinitiv. Antwort: went unregelmäßiges Verb]
2. When [_did] he [_play][!to play] hockey? → He [_played][!to play] hockey last Sunday. [?Frage: did + play did + Infinitiv. Antwort: played Infinitiv + ed]

4. When [_did] Jacob [_come][!to come] home? → He [_came][!to come] home at 8 o'clock pm. [?Frage: did + come did + Infinitiv. Antowrt: came unregelmäßiges Verb]
5. When [_did] the meeting [_finish][!to finish]? → It [_finished][!to finish] at midday. [?Frage: did + finish did + Infinitiv. Antwort: finished Infinitiv + ed]
6. When [_did] Sarah [_make][!to make] the cake? → She [_made][!to make] the cake two hours ago. [?Frage: did + make did + Infinitiv. Antowrt: made unregelmäßiges Verb]
7. What [_did] Richard [_check][!to check] last Friday afternoon? → He [_checked][!to check] a microwave. [?Frage: did + check did + Infinitiv. Antwort: checked Infinitiv + ed]
8. How [_did] Molly [_pay][!to pay]? → She [_paid][!to pay] in cash. [?Frage: did + pay did + Infinitiv. Antowrt: paid unregelmäßiges Verb]
9. When [_did] you [_send][!to send] the text message? → We [_sent][!to send] the text message at 10 o'clock am. [?Frage: did + send did + Infinitiv. Antowrt: sent unregelmäßiges Verb]

[!Setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde so eine Frage ohne Fragewort und die dazugehörige Kurzantwort im Simple Past. Beachte das Beispiel. ]

0. [_Did][@example] Florence help her mum the day before yesterday? → Yes, [_she did][@example]. 

1. [_Did] Ellie arrive at the airport last Friday? → Yes, [_she did]. [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: she + did]
2. [_Did] Oscar visit the museum yesterday? → No, [_he didn't]. [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: he + didn't oder he + did + not]
3. [_Did] you say hello to Charlie last night? → No, [_I didn't]. [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: I + didn't oder I + did + not oder we + didn't oder we + did + not]
4. [_Did] they invite friends last weekend? → Yes, [_they did. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: they + did]
5. [_Did] she take out the book an hour ago? → No, [_she didn't. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: she + didn't oder she + did + not]
6. [_Did] I forget my keys two days ago? → Yes, [_you did]. [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: I + did oder you + did]
7. [_Did] he ask questions in the last lesson? → No, [_he didn't. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: he + didn't oder he + did + not]
8. [_Did] Abbie drink water yesterday morning? → No, [_she didn't. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: she + didn't oder she + did + not]
9. [_Did] Arthur open the present yesterday evening? → Yes, [_he did. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: he + did]
10. [_Did] we feed the pets this morning? → Yes, [_you did. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: we + did oder you + did]

bit.hint: Frage: did. Kurzantwort: we + did oder you + did

bitmark:
[.cloze-and-multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:228777]
[%Nr. 4130]
[!In der Übung kannst du dein Wissen zu den Regeln im **Simple Past** testen. 
Suche dir dazu aus den vorgegebenen Antworten die richtige aus oder setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein. ]
1. Das __Simple Past__ verwende ich für Handlungen, [-die gerade abgeschlossen wurden][-die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen][+die in der Vergangenheit abgeschlossen sind]. 
2. Typische Signalwörter für das __Simple Past__ sind [-already, just, so far, yet][-at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now][+yesterday, last week, a month ago, in 2010]. 
3. Bei regelmäßigen Verben hänge ich die Endung [_ed] an den Infinitiv an. 
4. Falls das regelmäßige Verb auf **-e** endet, hänge ich nur ein [_d] an den Infinitiv an. 
5. Bei unregelmäßigen Verben nehme ich die Form aus der [-1. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben][+2. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben][-3. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben]. 
6. Die Verneinung bilde ich mit [+did + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][-do + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][-have/has + not + past participle]. 
7. Für **did + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform [_didn't] stehen. 
8. Bei **Fragen nach dem Objekt, des Ortes oder der Zeit** nehme ich [-das Verb im Simple Past][+did + Infinitiv des Verbs][-do + Infinitiv des Verbs]. 
9. Bei **Fragen nach dem Subjekt** nehme ich [+das Verb im Simple Past][-did + Infinitiv des Verbs][-do + Infinitiv des Verbs]. 
10. Das Verb **be** kann im Simple Past zwei Formen haben. 
Ich benutzte [_was] mit __I, he, she, it__ und [_were] mit __we, you, they__.

4. Falls das regelmäßige Verb auf **-e** endet, hänge ich nur ein {3} an den Infinitiv an. 
5. Bei unregelmäßigen Verben nehme ich die Form aus der {4}. 
6. Die Verneinung bilde ich mit {5}. 
7. Für **did + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform {6} stehen. 
8. Bei **Fragen nach dem Objekt, des Ortes oder der Zeit** nehme ich {7}. 
9. Bei **Fragen nach dem Subjekt** nehme ich {8}. 
10. Das Verb **be** kann im Simple Past zwei Formen haben. 
Ich benutzte {9} mit __I, he, she, it__ und {10} mit __we, you, they__.

[!Finde das richtige Signalwort für die Sätze im Simple Past. ]
1. Doris went skiing [-next Monday][-at the moment][-last Friday]. 
2. [+Yesterday][-Now][-Tomorrow] my grandma did not feel well. 
3. Betty stayed at Sue's house [-at the moment][+a week ago][-tomorrow]. 
4. Sophie took a shower [+this morning][-at the moment][-yet]. 
5. Stan was born [+in 1999][-now][-tomorrow]. 
6. I visited my uncle [+in the summer of 2011][-yet][-next week]. 
7. The cat jumped out of the window [+two hours ago][-next Friday][-already]. 
8. The police arrested the thieves [-usually][+last Sunday][-now]. 
9. Elisabeth worked in a restaurant [+from 2009 to 2012][-next summer][-since spring]. 
10. Our teacher missed the bus [-tomorrow morning][+yesterday morning][-at the moment].

6. I visited my uncle {5}.

[!Setze die Verben in Klammern in die Lücken ein. Verwende das Simple Past. Beachte, ob du einen Aussagesatz oder einen Fragesatz bilden sollst. ]

0. [_Did][@example] she [_surf][@example] the Internet? __(to surf)__

1. I [_did][!to do] my maths homework yesterday. [?unregelmäßiges Verb: do - did]
2. [_Did] Susan [_go][!to go] to England by plane? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
3. They [_visited][!to visit] a farm two weeks ago. [?Infinitiv + ed]
4. Jenny and Peggy [_did not help][_didn't help][!not/to help] their brother. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't help]
5. The children [_were not][_weren't][!not/to be] at home last weekend. [?Verneinung: were + not. Kurzform: weren't. Das Verb were (Infinitiv: be) kann direkt verneint werden. ]
6. When [_did] you [_design][!to design] this wonderful skirt? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
7. My mother [_did not crash][_didn't crash][!not/to crash] into the van. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't crash]
8. The boys [_took off][!to take off] the mudguards of their bicycles. [?unregelmäßiges Verb: take off - took off]
9. [_Did] you [_phone][!to phone] your aunt last week? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
10. He [_did not drink][_didn't drink][!not/to drink] milk at school. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't drink]

bit.body:
0. {0} she {1} the Internet? __(to surf)__

1. I {2} my maths homework yesterday. 
2. {3} Susan {4} to England by plane? 
3. They {5} a farm two weeks ago. 
4. Jenny and Peggy {6} their brother. 
5. The children {7} at home last weekend. 
6. When {8} you {9} this wonderful skirt? 
7. My mother {10} into the van. 
8. The boys {11} the mudguards of their bicycles. 
9. {12} you {13} your aunt last week? 
10. He {14} milk at school.
bit.hint: Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't drink

[%Nr. 4124]
[!Setze die Verben in Klammern in die Lücken ein. Verwende das Simple Past. Beachte, ob du einen Aussagesatz oder einen Fragesatz bilden sollst. ]

0. The children [_forgot][@example] their sandwiches last Monday. __(to forget)__

1. When [_were][!to be] you in London? [?Benutze were. Danach steht das Subjekt. Bei dieser Frage ist die Wortstellung wie im Deutschen. ]
2. We [_did not live][_didn't live][!not/to live] in a flat when we were in Paris. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't live]
3. What [_did] you [_lose][!to lose] yesterday? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
4. He [_did not do][_didn't do][!not/to do] magic tricks at the party. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't do]
5. Mandy [_did not tidy up][_didn't tidy up][!not/to tidy up] her room on Thursday. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't tidy up]
6. [_Did] Frank [_share][!to share] a room with Henry when they were in Rome? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
7. I [_did not like][_didn't like][!not/to like] physics at school. [?Verneinung: did + not + Infinitiv. Kurzform: didn't like]
8. [_Did] the shop assistant [_take][!to take] 10 percent off the price? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]
9. She [_used][!to use] the correct word in the exercise. [?Infinitiv + -d. Steht ein -e am Verbende, wird nur -d angehängt. ]
10. Why [_did] the baby [_cry][!to cry] this morning? [?Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs. ]

bit.body:
0. The children {0} their sandwiches last Monday. __(to forget)__

1. When {1} you in London? 
2. We {2} in a flat when we were in Paris. 
3. What {3} you {4} yesterday? 
4. He {5} magic tricks at the party. 
5. Mandy {6} her room on Thursday. 
6. {7} Frank {8} a room with Henry when they were in Rome? 
7. I {9} physics at school. 
8. {10} the shop assistant {11} 10 percent off the price? 
9. She {12} the correct word in the exercise. 
10. Why {13} the baby {14} this morning?
bit.hint: Benutze did. Danach steht das Subjekt. Anschließend folgt der Infinitiv des Verbs.

[.chapter]
[@id:228784]
[▼ch-3]
[##Present Perfect]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228785]
[%Nr. 1366]
[!Schreibe bei den folgenden Fragen die richtige Verbform in die Lücke. Benutze das **Present Perfect**. ]

0. [_Has][@example] she [_cleaned][@example] the car? (__to clean__) 

1. [_Have] you [_painted][!to paint] the kitchen door? [?have (wegen you + Subjekt + past participle (Infinitiv +-ed) + painted]
2. [_Has] your brother [_done][!to do] the shopping? [?has (wegen your brother) + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform) done]
3. [_Has] Julian ever [_touched][!to touch] a spider? [?has (wegen Julian) + Subjekt + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) touched]
4. [_Has] your father ever [_ridden][!to ride] on an elephant? [?has (wegen your father) + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform) ridden]
5. [_Has] Lee [_asked][!to ask] his parents yet? [?has (wegen Lee + Subjekt + past participle (Infinitiv +-ed) + asked]
6. What [_have] you [_written][!to write] in your text? [?have (wegen you) + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform) written]
7. [_Has] Bill [_turned off][!to turn off] the radio? [?has (wegen Bill) + Subjekt + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) turned off]
8. [_Have] you ever [_flown][!to fly] in a helicopter? [?have (wegen you) + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform) flown]
9. Who [_has broken][!to break] the window? [?has (wegen des Fragewortes who) + past participle (3. Verbform) broken. Das ist eien Subjektfrage. ]
10. [_Have] you ever [_cooked][!to cook] for your friends? [?have (wegen you) + Subjekt + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) cooked]

1. {2} you {3} the kitchen door? 
2. {4} your brother {5} the shopping? 
3. {6} Julian ever {7} a spider? 
4. {8} your father ever {9} on an elephant? 
5. {10} Lee {11} his parents yet?

bit.instruction: Schreibe bei den folgenden Fragen die richtige Verbform in die Lücke. Benutze das **Present Perfect**.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228786]
[%Nr. 1368]
[!Schreibe bei den folgenden Fragen die richtige Verbform im Present Perfect in die jeweilige Lücke. Beachte die Position des Subjekts und ein eventuell vorhandenes Signalwort. ]

0. [_Has she cleaned][@example] the car [_yet][@example]? (__she/to clean/yet__)

1. [_Has John lived] here [_for] five years? (__John/to live/for__) [?has + Subjekt John + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) lived]
2. [_Have the twins written] the e-mail to grandma [_yet]? (__the twins/to write/yet__) [?have + Subjekt the twins + past participle (3. Verbform) written]
3. Why [_has Dan spent] so much money on sweets? (__Dan/to spend__) [?has + Subjekt Dan + pas participle (3. Verbform) spent]
4. [__Has Sophie prepared] the talk in history [_yet]? (__Sophie/to prepare/yet__) [?has + Subjekt Sophie + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) prepared]
5. [_Have they ever left] the house before their parents in the morning? (__they/to leave/ever__) [?have + Subjekt they + past participle (3. Verbform) left]
6. How often [_have you yawned] in the last maths lesson? (__you/to yawn__) [?have + Subjekt you + past participle (Infinitiv +-ed) yawned]
7. [_Has the waiter laid] the round table for us [_yet]? (__the waiter/to lay/yet__) [?has + Subjekt the waiter + past participle (3. Verbform) laid]
8. What [_has Olivia done lately]? (__Olivia/to do/lately__) [?has + Subjekt Olivia + past participle (3. Verbform) done]
9. Where in the USA [_have you been]? (__you/to be__) [?have + Subjekt you + past participle (3. Verbform) been]
10. Why [_haven't you checked] the tyres [_yet]? (__you/not/to check/yet__) [?haven't + Subjekt you + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) checked]

bit.body:
0. {0} the car {1}? (__she/to clean/yet__)

1. {2} here {3} five years? (__John/to live/for__) 
2. {4} the e-mail to grandma {5}? (__the twins/to write/yet__) 
3. Why {6} so much money on sweets? (__Dan/to spend__) 
4. [__Has Sophie prepared] the talk in history {7}? (__Sophie/to prepare/yet__) 
5. {8} the house before their parents in the morning? (__they/to leave/ever__) 
6. How often {9} in the last maths lesson? (__you/to yawn__) 
7. {10} the round table for us {11}? (__the waiter/to lay/yet__) 
8. What {12}? (__Olivia/to do/lately__) 
9. Where in the USA {13}? (__you/to be__) 
10. Why {14} the tyres {15}? (__you/not/to check/yet__)
bit.hint: haven't + Subjekt you + past participle (Infinitiv + -ed) checked

3. [_Have] we won the prize? → No, [_you haven't]. [?Frage: have (wegen we). Kurzantwort: you + haven't oder you've + not oder you + have + not oder we + haven't oder we've + not oder we + have + not]
4. [_Has] Ben written the essay? → Yes, [_he has]. [?Frage: has (wegen Ben). Kurzantwort: he + has]
5. [_Have] they tried bungee jumping? → No, [_they haven't]. [?Frage: have (wegen they). Kurzantwort: they + haven't oder they + have + not]

9. [_Have] you watched the video? → No, [_I haven't]. [?Frage: have (wegen) you. Kurzantwort: I + haven't oder I + have + not oder we + haven't oder we + have + not]
10. [_Has] it snowed in San Francisco? → No, [_it hasn't. ] [?Frage: has (wegen it). Kurzantwort: it + hasn't oder it + has + not]

3. My father [_has not polished][_hasn't polished] the car. It is still dirty. __(not/to polish)__ [?Benutze has (wegen my father) + not + past participle (Infinitiv + Endung -ed) polished. polish ist ein regelmäßiges Verb. ]
4. The children [_have not read][_haven't read] the comics [_yet]. __(not/to read/yet)__ [?Benutze have (wegen the children) + not + past participle (3. Verbform) read. read ist ein unregelmäßiges Verb. Setze das Signalwort yet an das Satzende. ]
5. Jason and Tony [_have not learned][_haven't learned] the words, so they will probably fail the test. __(not/to learn)__ [?Benutze have (wegen Jason and Tony) + not + past participle (Infinitiv + Endung -ed) learned. lear ist ein regelmäßiges Verb, die unregelmäßige Form learnt ist auch richtig. ]
6. His mother [_has not made][_hasn't made] breakfast [_so far]. __(not/to make/so far)__ [?Benutze has (wegen his mother) + not + past participle (3. Verbform) made. make ist ein unregelmäßiges Verb. Setze das Signalwort so far an das Satzende. ]
7. I [_have not skated][_haven't skated] on a lake in winter [_yet]. __(not/to skate/yet)__ [?Benutze have (wegen I) + not + past participle (Infinitiv + Endung -ed) skated. skate ist ein regelmäßiges Verb - nur -d angehängen, da das Verb auf -e endet. Kurzform: I haven't skated. Setze das Signalwort yet an das Satzende. ]
8. My boss [_has never phoned] the helpline. __(not/to wash/never)__ [?Benutze has (wegen my boss) + never + past participle (Infinitiv + Endung -ed) phoned. phone ist ein regelmäßiges Verb - nur -d angehängen, da das Verb auf -e endet. ]
9. He [_has not washed][_hasn't washed] his favourite T-shirt himself. __(not/to wash)__ [?Benutze has (wegen he) + not + past participle (Infinitiv + Endung -ed) washed. washt ist ein regelmäßiges Verb. ]

[!In der Übung kannst du dein Wissen zu den Regeln im **Present Perfect** testen. 
Suche dir dazu aus den vorgegebenen Antworten die richtige aus oder setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein. ]
1. Das __Present Perfect__ verwende ich für Handlungen, [+bei denen das Resultat in der Gegenwart wichtig ist][-die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen][-die in der Vergangenheit abgeschlossen wurden]. 
2. Typische Signalwörter für das __Present Perfect__ sind [+already, just, so far, yet][-always, every day, often, sometimes][-at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now]. 
3. Für das __Present Perfect__ benutze ich [-do/does + Infinitiv des Verbs][-had + past participle][+have/has + past participle]
4. Die **Verneinung** bilde ich mit [-did + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][-do + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][+have/has + not + past participle]. 
5. Bei **Verneinungen in der 3. Person Singular** __(he, she, it)__, nehme ich [-did + not + Infinitiv des Verbs][+has + not + past participle][-have + not + past participle]. 
6. Für **have + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform [_haven't] stehen, für **has + not** __kann__ [_hasn't] stehen. 
7. Beim __past participle__ hänge ich die Endung [_ed] an den Infinitiv der **regelmäßigen Verben** an. 
8. Bei **unregelmäßigen Verben** nehme ich die Form aus der [-1. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben][-2. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben][+3. Spalte der Tabelle der unregelmäßigen Verben].

bit.body:
1. Das __Present Perfect__ verwende ich für Handlungen, {0}. 
2. Typische Signalwörter für das __Present Perfect__ sind {1}. 
3. Für das __Present Perfect__ benutze ich {2}
4. Die **Verneinung** bilde ich mit {3}. 
5. Bei **Verneinungen in der 3. Person Singular** __(he, she, it)__, nehme ich {4}. 
6. Für **have + not** __kann__ auch die Kurzform {5} stehen, für **has + not** __kann__ {6} stehen. 
7. Beim __past participle__ hänge ich die Endung {7} an den Infinitiv der **regelmäßigen Verben** an. 
8. Bei **unregelmäßigen Verben** nehme ich die Form aus der {8}.

[#Die __Progrressive/Continuous__ Zeitformen (Verlaufsfomen)]

[.chapter]
[@id:228822]
[▼ch-8]
[##Present Progressive]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:228823]
[%Nr. 1310]
[!Schreibe die richtige Verbform in die Lücke. Benutze das **Present Progressive**. ]

0. [_Is][@example] he [_reading][@example] the newspaper? (__to read__)

1. [_Is] Richard [_working][!to work] in the garden? [?is (wegen Richard) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing working]
2. [_Is] she [_having][!to have] a cup of tea? [?is (wegen she) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing having. Das stumme -e bei have am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt.]
3. [_Are] the children [_doing][!to do] their homework? [?are (wegen the children) + Subejkt + Infinitiv + -ing doing]
4. [_Are] you [_cleaning][!to clean] the kitchen, Tom? [?are (wegen you) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing cleaning]
5. [_Is] the cat [_sleeping][!to sleep] in the basket? [?is (wegen the cat) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing sleeping]
6. [_Are] Cliff and Oliver [_meeting][!to meet] friends? [?are (wegen Cliff and Oliver) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing meeting]
7. [_Is] your mother [_making][!to make] sandwiches? [?is (wegen your mother) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing making. Das stumme -e bei make am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]
8. [_Are] the birds [_drinking][!to drink] water? [?are (wegen the birds) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing drinking]
9. [_Is] Carmen [_wearing][!to wear] a pullover? [?is (wegen Carmen) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing wearing]
10. [_Are] they [_eating][!to eat] a pizza? [?are (wegen they) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing eating]

bit.body:
0. {0} he {1} the newspaper? (__to read__)

1. {2} Richard {3} in the garden? 
2. {4} she {5} a cup of tea? 
3. {6} the children {7} their homework? 
4. {8} you {9} the kitchen, Tom? 
5. {10} the cat {11} in the basket? 
6. {12} Cliff and Oliver {13} friends? 
7. {14} your mother {15} sandwiches? 
8. {16} the birds {17} water? 
9. {18} Carmen {19} a pullover? 
10. {20} they {21} a pizza?
bit.hint: are (wegen they) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing eating

[%Nr. 1370]
[!Schreibe die richtigen Verbformen und die Substantive in die Lücken. Benutze das **Present Progressive**. ]

1. [_Is Lisa swimming][!Lisa/to swim] in the lake? [?is (wegen Lisa) + Subjekt Lisa + Infinitiv + -ing swimming. Das -m am Wortende von swim wird verdoppelt (kurzer Vokal -i). ]
2. [_Are you helping][!you/to help] your brother? [?are (wegen you) + Subjekt you + Infinitiv + -ing helping]
3. [_Is he visiting][!he/to visit] a museum? [?is (wegen you + Subjekt he + Infinitiv + -ing) visiting]
4. [_Is Doris washing][!Doris/to wash] her T-shirt? [?is (wegen Doris) + Subjekt Doris + Infinitiv + -ing) washing]
5. [_Are they running][!they/to run] home? [?are (wegen they) + Subjekt they + Infinitiv + -ing running. Das -n am Wortende von run wird verdoppelt (kurzer gesprochener Vokal -a). ]
6. [_Is Henry listening][!Henry/to listen] to the radio? [?is (wegen Henry) + Subjekt Henry + Infinitiv + -ing listening]
7. [_Are the boys carrying][!the boys/to carry] the buckets? [?are (wegen the boys) + Subjekt the boys + Infinitiv + -ing carrying]
8. [_Is she holding][!she/to hold] the string of the kite? [?is (wegen she) + Subjekt she + Infinitiv + -ing holding]
9. [_Are we making][!we/to make] breakfast? [?are (wegen we) + Subjekt we + Infinitiv + -ing making. Das stumme -e bei make am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]]
10. [_Are Ron and Fred checking][!Ron and Fred/to check] the computer? [?are (wegen Ron and Fred) + Subjekt Ron and Fred + Infinitiv + -ing checking]

bit.body:
0. {0} the newspaper? (__he/to read__)

1. {1} in the lake? 
2. {2} your brother? 
3. {3} a museum? 
4. {4} her T-shirt? 
5. {5} home? 
6. {6} to the radio? 
7. {7} the buckets? 
8. {8} the string of the kite? 
9. {9} breakfast? ]
10. {10} the computer?
bit.hint: are (wegen Ron and Fred) + Subjekt Ron and Fred + Infinitiv + -ing checking

5. What [_are they reading][!they/to read]? [?Fragewort + are (wegen they) + Subjekt they + Infinitiv read + Endung ing]
6. Where [_is the cat sleeping][!the cat/to sleep]? [?Fragewort + is (wegen the cat) + Subjekt the cat + Infinitiv sleep + Endung ing]

[@id:228826]
[%Nr. 4676]
[!Setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde so eine Frage ohne Fragewort und die dazugehörige Kurzantwort im **Present Progressive**. Beachte das Beispiel. ]

0. [_Is][@example] Harry reading comics? → Yes, [_he is][@example]. 

1. [_Is] Sam going to the office? → Yes, [_he is]. [?Frage: is (wegen Sam). Kurzantwort: he + is]
2. [_Are] Lisa and Emma running home? → Yes, [_they are]. [?Frage: are (wegen Lisa and Emma). Kurzantwort: they + are]
3. [_Is] she playing the piano? → No, [_she isn't. ] [?Frage: is (wegen she). Kurzantwort: she + isn't oder she + is + not]
4. [_Are] you texting Lenny? → Yes, [_I am]. [?Frage: are (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + am oder we + are]
5. [_Is] the lady swimming in the lake? → Yes, [_she is]. [?Frage: is (wegen the lady). Kurzantwort: she + is]
6. [_Is] the man buying oranges? → No, [_he isn't]. [?Frage: is (wegen the man). Kurzantwort: he + isn't oder he + is + not]
7. [_Are] the friends having an ice cream? → No, [_they aren't]. [?Frage: are (wegen the friends). Kurzantwort: they + aren't oder they + are + not]
8. [_Is] the lion sleeping? → Yes, [_it is]. [?Frage: is (wegen the lion). Kurzantwort: it + is]
9. [_Are] they drinking tea? → No, [_they aren't]. [?Frage: are (wegen they). Kurzantwort: they + aren't oder they + are + not]
10. [_Are] you waiting for the bus? → No, [_we aren't]. [?Frage: are (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I'm + not oder I + am + not oder we + aren't oder we're + not oder we + are + not]

bit.body:
0. {0} Harry reading comics? → Yes, {1}. 

1. {2} Sam going to the office? → Yes, {3}. 
2. {4} Lisa and Emma running home? → Yes, {5}. 
3. {6} she playing the piano? → No, {7} 
4. {8} you texting Lenny? → Yes, {9}. 
5. {10} the lady swimming in the lake? → Yes, {11}. 
6. {12} the man buying oranges? → No, {13}. 
7. {14} the friends having an ice cream? → No, {15}. 
8. {16} the lion sleeping? → Yes, {17}. 
9. {18} they drinking tea? → No, {19}. 
10. {20} you waiting for the bus? → No, {21}.
bit.hint: Frage: are (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I'm + not oder I + am + not oder we + aren't oder we're + not oder we + are + not

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:228832]
[%Nr. 4076]
[!Übersetze die folgenden Sätze bzw. Fragen ins Englische. Verwende immer das **Present Progressive**. ]
===
Wir schreiben jetzt einen Brief. 
[@example:We are writing a letter. ]
===
1. Mandy spielt jetzt Karten. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$Mandy is playing cards. ]
===
2. Hör mal! Jenny singt. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$Listen! Jenny is singing. ]
===
3. Ich mache das Badezimmer sauber. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$I am cleaning the bathroom. ]
===
4. Wartet Max im Auto?
[@shortAnswer]
[$Is Max waiting in the car?]
===
5. Sieh mal! Es regnet. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$Look! It is raining. ]
===
6. Ich lese ein Buch. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$I am reading a book. ]
===
7. Der Lehrer kommt!
[@shortAnswer]
[$The teacher is coming!]
===
8. Was machst du hier?
[@shortAnswer]
[$What are you doing here?]
===
9. Wir trinken Milch. 
[@shortAnswer]
[$We are drinking milk. ]
===

[$They are watching a film. ]

bitmark:
[.cloze-and-multiple-choice-text:bitmark--][%Nr. 4166]
[@id:228840]
[!In der Übung kannst du dein Wissen zu den Regeln im **Present Progressive** testen. 
Suche dir dazu aus den vorgegebenen Antworten die richtige aus oder setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein. ]
1. Das __Present Progressive__ verwende ich für Handlungen, [-die gerade abgeschlossen wurden][+die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen][-die wiederholt geschehen]. 
2. Das __Present Progressive__ besteht immer aus mindestens [-einem Wort][+zwei Wörtern][-drei Wörtern]. 
3. Typische Signalwörter für das __Present Progressive__ sind [-already, just, so far, yet][-always,every day, often, sometimes][+at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now]
4. Für __Present Progressive__ benutze ich [-den Infinitiv des Verbs][+am/are/is + Infinitiv des Verbs +-ing][-have/has und das past participle]. 
5. In der 3. Person Singular __(he, she, it)__, wird das Hilfsverb [-am][-are][+is] benutzt. 
6. Bei der Verneinung im __Present Progressive__ steht not [-vor dem Hilfsverb am/are/is][+nach dem Hilfsverb am/are/is][-nach dem Infinitiv + -ing]
7. Beim __Present Progressive__ hänge ich die Endung [_ing] an den Infinitiv des Verbs an. 
8. Für are + not __kann__ auch die Kurzform [_aren't] stehen, für is + not __kann__ [_isn't] stehen. 
9. Man kann von allen Verben eine __progressive__ Form bilden. → [-richtig][+falsch]
10. Wenn man die Endung __-ing__ an den Infinitiv des Verbs anhängt, muss man manchmal **Buchstaben verdoppeln oder weglassen**. → [+richtig][-falsch]

options.text: die im Moment des Sprechens geschehen
at the moment, Listen!, Look!, now

0. [_Was][@example] she [_reading][@example] a book? (__to read__)

1. [_Was] Ashley [_working] on the computer? (__to work__) [?was (wegen Ashely) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing working]
2. [_Were] they [_repairing] the bike? (__to repair__) [?were (wegen they) + Subjekt + Infinitiv +-ing repairing]
3. [_Was] Melissa [_taking] out a book? (__to take__) [?was (wegen Melissa) + Subjekt + Infinitiv +-ing taking. Das stumme -e bei take am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]
4. [_Were] you [_listening] to music? (__to listen__) [?was (wegen you) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing listening]
5. [_Was] Nicolas [_looking] at a picture? (__to look__) [?was (wegen Nicolas) + Subjekt + Infintiiv + -ing looking]
6. [_Were] Emma and Bertha [_phoning] their friend? (__to phone__) [?were (wegen Emma and Bertha) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing phoning. Das stumme -e bei phone am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]
7. [_Was] the girl [_opening] the window? (__to open__) [?was (wegen the girl) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing opening]
8. [_Was] he [_doing] judo? (__to do__) [?was (wegen he) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing doing]
9. [_Were] the friends [_coming] home from school? (__to come__) [?were (wegen the friends) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing coming. Das stumme -e bei come am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]
10. [_Was] Tyler [_helping] with the cooking? (__to help__)
[?was (wegen Tyler) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing helping]

0. [_Was][@example] Stella playing tennis at 5 pm? → Yes, [_she was][@example]. 

1. [_Was] Ann waiting for her friend when you saw her? → Yes, [_she was]. [?was (wegen Ann). Kurzantwort: she + was]
2. [_Were] the players talking to the journalist yesterday at 6? → Yes, [_they were]. [?were (wegen the players). Kurzantwort: they + were]
3. [_Was] he making a phone call when you arrived? → No, [_he wasn't]. [?was (wegen he). Kurzantwort: he + wasn't oder he + was + not]
4. [_Were] Chris and Alex watching a film last night? → No, [_they weren't]. [?were (wegen Chris and Alex). Kurzantwort: they + weren't oder they + were + not]
5. [_Were] they chatting the whole evening? → Yes, [_they were. ]
[?were (wegen they). Kurzantwort: they + were]
6. [_Was] Sophie making breakfast on Friday morning? → No, [_she wasn't]. [?was (wegen Sophie). Kurzantwort: she + wasn't oder she + was + not]
7. [_Were] you cleaning the windows when Lydia left? → No, [_I wasn't]. [?were (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + wasn't oder I + was + not oder we + weren't oder we + were + not]
8. [_Was] the man watching the shop at around 9? → Yes, [_he was. ] [?was (wegen the man. Kurzantwort: he + was]
9. [_Were] you babysitting yesterday night? → Yes, [_I was. ] [?were (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + was oder we + were]
10. [_Was] it raining when you came home? → No, [_it wasn't. ] [?Frage: was (wegen it). Kurzantwort: it + wasn't oder it + was + not]

bit.hint: Frage: was (wegen it). Kurzantwort: it + wasn't oder it + was + not

[@id:228918]
[%Nr. 4462-2]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __Present Progressive__?]
[+Are you cleaning the floor?]
[-Are you from New Zealand?]
[+I'm making a cheese cake right now. ]
[-Have you already had a cup of tea yet?]
[-Last year we were in France. ]
[-Wait a moment! I'll carry this box for you. ]
===
[!2. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __will-future__?]
[-Does this train leave from platform 12?]
[+He'll never make it. ]
[+I think Sue will arrive at 6 o'clock. ]
[-Pat is not going to fly to Paris in May. ]
[-They are coming to the party. ]
[+We won't be at your party. ]
===
[!3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __Simple Past__?]
[+Did you phone me last night?]
[-Emily has just come home from school. ]
[+I lived in Odessa from 1985 to 1986. ]
[-There will be some rain in the East. ]
[-They play tennis every Friday afternoon. ]
[+Yesterday my friend invited me to his party. ]
===
[!4. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __going to-future__?]
[+Are they going to look for a present?]
[-Are they in the school choir?]
[-Christine is going to walk to town. ]
[+I am not going to send a text message to Bob. ]
[-She has never been to Africa. ]
[-The teacher is checking the homework. ]
===
[!5. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __Present Perfect__?]
[-I have a brother. ]
[+I've forgotten my homework. ]
[+Have you ever been to Edinburgh?]
[-Last year I was in Salt Lake City. ]
[+She hasn't visited her uncle for half a year. ]
[-We aren't phoning now. ]
===
[!6. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das __Simple Present__?]
[-at the moment]
[+every day]
[-just]
[+often]
[+sometimes]
[-yesterday]
===
[!7. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das __Present Perfect__?]
[+already]
[+just]
[-Look!]
[-two hours ago]
[-usually]
[+yet]
===
[!8. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das __Present Progressive__?]
[+at the moment]
[+Listen!]
[-never]
[-next week]
[+now]
[-yesterday]
===
[!9. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das __Simple Past__?]
[-ever]
[+in 1999]
[+last month]
[-now]
[+three days ago]
[+yesterday]
===
[!10. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im __Simple Present__?]
[+Anne does not play chess. ]
[+Do they go for a walk?]
[+He is from Japan. ]
[-She is listening to an audio book. ]
[-We are not going to feed the pets. ]
[+We play soccer every weekend. ]
===

[_They play cards. ]
2. Simple Past
[_They played cards. ]
3. will-future
[_They will play cards. ][_They'll play cards. ]
4. going to-future
[_They are going to play cards. ][_They're going to play cards. ]
5. Present Progressive
[_They are playing cards. ][_They're playing cards. ]
6. Present Perfect
[_They have played cards. ][_They've played cards. ]

bit.body:
Hello,
My name is Susan. I'm forteen and I life in Germany. My hobbys are go to discos and jogging, sometimes I hear music in the radio. In the July I go swimming in a sea . I haven't any brothers or sisters. We take busses to scool. I visit year 9 at my school. My birthday is on Friday. I hope I will become a new guitar. 
I'm looking forward to get a e-mail from you. 

Yours,
Susan

Jack and Peter [_are] her friends. They [_are] in the same class. Mr and Mrs Baker [_are] on a trip to the USA to visit their cousin Anne. She [_is] a nice girl. Peter says: "My grandfather [_is] is hospital. I [_am] at home with my grandmother. " What time [_is] it? It [_is] 8 o'clock. Are [_you] tired? No I [_am] not.

bit.body:
0. They {0} English. 

Peter Baker {1} from Manchester, but Paul and John {2} from London. Manchester and London {3} cities in England. Hamburg {4} a city in Germany. Sandra {5} at school today. Jack and Peter {6} her friends. They {7} in the same class. Mr and Mrs Baker {8} on a trip to the USA to visit their cousin Anne. She {9} a nice girl. Peter says: "My grandfather {10} is hospital. I {11} at home with my grandmother. " What time {12} it? It {13} 8 o'clock. Are {14} tired? No I {15} not.

[@id:228977]
[%Nr. 1730]
[!Übersetze die fehlenden Formen ins Englische. Du kannst sowohl Langformen als auch Kurzformen benutzen. ]

0. Sie ist glücklich. → [_She is][@example] happy. __oder__ Sie ist glücklich. → She[_'s][@example] happy. 

1. Ich bin aus Schwerin. → [_I am][_I'm] from Schwerin. 
2. Er ist nicht in der Schule. → [_He is][_He's] at school. 
3. Wir sind im Auto. → [_We are][_We're] in the car. 
4. Sie sind keine Engländer. → [_They are not][_They're not][_They aren't] English. 
5. Seid ihr aus New York? → [_Are you] from New York?
6. Sind sie hier? → [_Are they] here?
7. Wo bist du? → Where [_are you]?
8. Sie ist nicht krank. → [_She is not][_She's not][_She isn't] ill. 
9. Ist es neu? → [_Is it] new?
10. Sie sind im Urlaub. → [_They are][_They're] on holiday.

bit.body:
0. Sie ist glücklich. → {0} happy. __oder__ Sie ist glücklich. → She{1} happy. 

1. Ich bin aus Schwerin. → {2} from Schwerin. 
2. Er ist nicht in der Schule. → {3} at school. 
3. Wir sind im Auto. → {4} in the car. 
4. Sie sind keine Engländer. → {5} English. 
5. Seid ihr aus New York? → {6} from New York?
6. Sind sie hier? → {7} here?
7. Wo bist du? → Where {8}?
8. Sie ist nicht krank. → {9} ill. 
9. Ist es neu? → {10} new?
10. Sie sind im Urlaub. → {11} on holiday.

1. Our trip to Spain [_was] __(+)__ great. 
2. I [_wasn't] __(-)__ in London last summer.

bit.body:

1. Our trip to Spain {2} __(+)__ great. 
2. I {3} __(-)__ in London last summer. 
3. My sister and her friend {4} __(+)__ at a nice restaurant. 
4. I went to Olivia, but she {5} __(-)__ at home. 
5. Where {6} __(+)__ you last weekend?
6. My friends {7} __(-)__ very busy. 
7. The weather {8} __(-)__ good, there {9} a very cold wind. 
8. The exercises {10} __(+)__ easy, they {11} difficult. 
9. Lisa and Henry {12} __(-)__ very happy, they {13} __(+)__ angry.

[%Nr. 1804]
[!Ersetze das Modalverb im Satz durch die passende Ersatzform. ]
I must do my homework. 
**BEISPIL:**
I [-are able to][-are allowed to][-are supposed to][+have to][@example] do my homework. 

1. We can see the tower from our hotel. 
We [+are able to][-are allowed to][-are supposed to][-have to] see the tower from our hotel. 
2. We may use a dictionary in the test. 
We [-are able to][+are allowed to][-are supposed to][-have to] use a dictionary in the test. 
3. He can't play tennis very well. 
He [+is not able to][-is not allowed to][-is not supposed to][-does not have to] play tennis very well. 
4. We must leave Ottawa on Friday. 
We [-are able to][-are allowed to][-are supposed to][+have to] leave Ottawa on Friday. 
5. She mustn't use her smartphone in the hospital. 
She [-is not able to][+is not allowed to][-is not supposed to][-does not have to] use her smartphone in the hospital. 
6. You needn't clean the room. 
You [-are not able to][-are not allowed to][-are supposed to][+do not have to] clean the room. 
7. You may not copy my homework. 
You [-are not able to][+are not allowed to][-are supposed to][-do not have to] copy my homework. 
8. You should take an extra shirt. 
You [+are able to][-are allowed to][+are supposed to][-have to] take an extra shirt. 
9. He shouldn't go to bed so late. 
He [-is not able to][-is not allowed to][+is not supposed to][-does not have to] go to bed so late. 
10. Need we go?
[-Are we able to][-Are we allowed to][-Are we supposed to][+Do we have to] go?

bitmark:

[@id:228989]
[%Nr. 1808]
[!Durch welchen der drei Sätze, die jeweils ein Modalverb enthalten, kann der vorgegebene Satz ersetzt werden?]
===
[!1. They are able to speak English well. ]
[+They can speak English well. ]
[-They may speak English well. ]
[-They must speak English well. ]
===
[!2. Steve is not allowed to stay out late. ]
[+Steve may not stay out late. ]
[-Steve might not stay out late. ]
[-Steve need not stay out late. ]
===
[!3. Do I have to clean the kitchen?]
[-Can I clean the kitchen?]
[+Must I clean the kitchen?]
[-Should I clean the kitchen?]
===
[!4. Are you able to drive a tractor?]
[+Can you drive a tractor?]
[-Must you drive a tractor?]
[-Should you drive a tractor?]
===
[!5. We are not allowed to swim when the red flag is flying. ]
[+We must not swim when the red flag is flying. ]
[-We need not swim when the red flag is flying. ]
[-We should not swim when the red flag is flying. ]
===
[!6. She is not able to read Chinese. ]
[+She cannot read Chinese. ]
[-She may not read Chinese. ]
[-She need not read Chinese. ]
===
[!7. Do you think we are allowed to park here?]
[+Do you think we may park here?]
[-Do you think we must park here?]
[-Do you think we need park here?]
===
[!8. You don't have to do this exercise. ]
[-You must not do this exercise. ]
[+You need not do this exercise. ]
[-You should not do this exercise. ]
===
[!9. We have to stop when the traffic lights are red. ]
[-We can stop when the traffic lights are red. ]
[-We may stop when the traffic lights are red. ]
[+We must stop when the traffic lights are red. ]
===
[!10. Am I allowed to ask a question?]
[+May I ask a question?]
[-Must I ask a question?]
[-Should I ask a question?]
===

===

bit.title: Kurzformen und Langformen von Hilfsverben – Übungen

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:229015]
[%Nr. 1766]
[!Bilde die Kurzformen und schreibe die Formen in die Lücken. 

Benutze für den Apostroph ' das Zeichen neben dem Ä auf der Tastatur. Wenn du das Akzentzeichen ´ benutzt, wird die Lösung falsch angezeigt. ]
1. you have got → [_you've got]
2. you are → [_you're]
3. it is not → [_it's not][_it isn't]
4. I cannot → [_I can't]
5. they do not → [_they don't]
6. he has got → [_he's got]
7. she will → [_she'll]
8. he does not → [_he doesn't]
9. what is → [_what's]
10. we will not → [_we won't]

bit.instruction:
Bilde die Kurzformen und schreibe die Formen in die Lücken. 

Benutze für den Apostroph ' das Zeichen neben dem Ä auf der Tastatur. Wenn du das Akzentzeichen ´ benutzt, wird die Lösung falsch angezeigt.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:229016]
[%Nr. 1782]
[!Bilde die Kurzformen der **unterstrichenen** Satzteile und schreibe diese in die jeweiligen Lücken. 

Benutze für den Apostroph ' das Zeichen neben dem Ä auf der Tastatur. Wenn du das Akzentzeichen ´ benutzt, wird die Lösung falsch angezeigt. ]
1. You **should not** talk so much. → You [_shouldn't] talk so much. 
2. **They have** written the text. → [_They've] written the texxt. 
3. **Let us** go home. → [_Let's] go home. 
4. He **did not** play cards. → He [_didn't] play cards. 
5. I **could not** find my pen. → I [_couldn't] find my pen.

**he – (to) write – letters**

jeweils eine **Frage** in der vorgegebenen Zeitform. ]

0. Simple Present - [_Does he write letters][@example]?

1. Simple Present - [_Does he write letters]? [?does (wegen he) + Subjekt + Infinitiv]
2. Present Progressive - [_Is he writing letters]? [?is (wegen he) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing. Das stumme -e bei write am Wortende fällt weg, danach wird -ing angehängt. ]
3. Simple Past - [_Did he write letters]? [?did + Subjekt + Infinitiv]
4. Past Progressive - [_Was he writing letters]? [?was (wegen he) + Subjekt + Infinitiv + -ing. Das stumme -e bei write am Wortende fällt weg. ]
5. Present Perfect - [_Has he written letters]? [?has (wegen he) + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform)]
6. Present Perfect Progressive - [_Has he been writing letters]? [?has (wegen he) + Subjekt + been + Infinitiv + -ing. Das stumme -e bei write am Wortende fällt weg. ]
7. Past Perfect - [_Had he written letters]? [?had + Subjekt + past participle (3. Verbform)]
8. will-future - [_Will he write letters]? [?will + Subjekt + Infinitiv]
9. going to-future - [_Is he going to write letters]? [?is (wegen he) + Subjekt + going to + Infinitiv]
10. Conditional - [_Would he write letters]? [?would + Subjekt + Infinitiv]

[!Setze die fehlenden Wörter in die Lücken ein und bilde so eine Frage ohne Fragewort und die dazugehörige Kurzantwort. Beachte die Zeitform und das Beispiel. ]

0. [_Is][@example] Marie going for a walk now? → Yes, [_she is]. 

1. [_Does] he play an instrument? → Yes, [_he does]. [?Frage: does (wegen he). Kurzantwort: he + does]
2. [_Is] Sophie making breakfast now? → Yes, [_she is]. [?Frage: is (wegen Sophie). Kurzantwort: she + is]
3. [_Did] they visit Jolin last weekend? → No, [_they didn't]. [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: they + didn't oder they + did + not]
4. [_Has] she spoken to her boss? → Yes, [_she has]. [?Frage: has (wegen she). Kurzantwort: she + has]
5. [_Did] Tom arrive at the airport yesterday? → Yes, [_he did. ] [?Frage: did. Kurzantwort: he + did]
6. [_Do] you watch videos every day? → No, [_I don't. ] [?Frage: do (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + don't oder I + do + not oder we + don't oder we + do + not]
7. [_Have] you ever been to Alaska? → No, [_I haven't]. [?Frage: have (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + haven't oder I've + not oder I + have + not oder we + haven't oder we've + not oder we + have + not]
8. [_Will] it rain in London tomorrow? → No, [_it won't]. [?Frage: will. Kurzantwort: it + won't oder it + will + not]
9. [_Are] you going to repair my bike tomorrow? → Yes, [_I am]. [?Frage: are (wegen you). Kurzantwort: I + am oder we + are]
10. [_Was] he playing on the smartphone when you arrived? → No, [_he wasn't]. [?Frage: was (wegen he). Kurzantwort: he + wasn't oder he + was + not]

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:229053]
[%Nr. 4644]
[!In der linken Spalte stehen verschiedene Umschreibungen für Handlungen. Ordne die richtige Zeitform aus den Vorgaben rechts zu. ]
1. allgemeine Aussagen → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will future]
2. Handlungen haben in der Vergangenheit begonnen und sind abgeschlossen → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
3. Handlungen geschehen im Moment des Sprechens → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
4. Resultat einer vergangenen Handlung ist in der Gegenwart wichtig → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
5. Handlungsfolgen in der Gegenwart → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will future]
6. Handlungsfolgen in der Vergangenheit → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
7. Vorgang begann in der Vergangenheit und dauert bis in die Gegenwart → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
8. Handlung, die sich im Verlauf befand, als eine neue Handlung diese unterbrach → [-going to-future][+Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
9. regelmäßig wiederholte Handlungen → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will future]
10. Vorhersage von zukünftigen Handlungen → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][+will future]
11. zukünftige Handlungen sind geplant → [+going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
12. zukünftige Handlungen sind bereits fest geplant → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
13. zukünftige Handlungen stehen fest (Fahrplan) → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will future]
14. Handlungen, die nur vorübergehend stattfinden → [-going to-future][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will future]
